body:
Committed few seconds ago
$ svn ci -m "Adding a .gitignore for github contributors. Thanks Daniel"
Adding         .gitignore
Transmitting file data .
Committed revision 1600290.
You're welcome!

These are actually open ended ranges with the respective lower bound, so this is exactly the range intended by the other (invalid) format.

Per spec:
If a version range is specified as a single version, it must be interpreted as the range [version,âˆž).

right, forgot that detail ;)

works for me

Hi @struberg,
I saw you have the right to commit.
Would you mind reviewing and confirming my contribution?
Thanks in advance.

Hi! Yes, will check - thanks!
I'll review and comment on github first, ok?

@struberg 
Sure, of course.
Was my assumption that this happens on Github.
Thanks.

Beside that I'd like to mention that I am not so experienced with the implicit rules on Github yet.
Therefore I thought it is a good idea to ask a specific person via a comment to review and confirm the contribution.
I hope this is allright.

@struberg 
Do you need any additional information?
Hey @danielsoro, why not using a plain constant instead of creating another abstraction?

Hey @rmannibucau yes, your idea sounds better. :)
changing PT in a minute.
Hey @rmannibucau, I updated the PR and issue title as well. :)

I was about to write the same.
ResourceBundle.getBundle() is by itself a factory method to create a resource bundle. No need to create another one.

Thanks Daniel.

Patch applied:
https://github.com/apache/openwebbeans/commit/970a1da7ccd94eb3d46b04a7c5c523f4458d195d
applied, thanks Jon!
applied, thanks Jon!
This has been applied to SVN
This has been applied to SVN
This has been applied to SVN
This has been applied to SVN
This has been applied to SVN
Pushed to the branch! Thanks Thomas! :)
@struberg can you review? I could apply it then. I would like to have a clean as possible jira/github :D
@mbechler the changes seems to be applied. Could you close the PR plz? thanks

@struberg @rmannibucau 
it's now implemented by weld:

> You can now use InterceptionFactory with an interface as a parameter (WELD-2550, WELD-2533)
    This means the proxy class will be based off an interface which is by definition always proxyable
    You can therefore even supply an unproxyable implementation and it will still work
    Note that this is experimental feature with some limitations to it, see Weld docs for more details


https://issues.jboss.org/browse/WELD-2550
https://issues.jboss.org/browse/WELD-2533

should we apply it?
@tandraschko we should review our behavior and weld one, probably test a few more cases (like default methods) but otherwise +1 to get it asap
Could you maybe describe some tests you would do - so @kalgon could add it?

Sure, out of my head:

1. no interceptor on the interface
2. interceptors on the interface
3. 1 + configured bindings programmatically
4. 2 + configured bindings programmatically
5. default method handling

Guess it can be enough to merge and be secured enough it works for common use cases. Wdyt?

sounds good!

@kalgon would you like to add some unittests? Would be be a great addition.

@tandraschko I am on it but I have a weird problem. When simply producing a bean based on an interface which has interceptor bindings already, it is proxied and intercepted without needing to use the InterceptionFactory. And when I explicitly create an intercepted instance with the IF, my bean gets intercepted twice...

@kalgon yes, we always supported interceptors on producers in OWB cause it was too limiting to not do it in CDI < 2.0, there is a flag to switch it off in openwebbeans.properties but i'd recommand to keep it and just ignore it if the instance was created from interception factory.
@rmannibucau I had to check if the produced instance is an `OwbInterceptorProxy` in `AbstractProducer` to avoid intercepting twice. I hope this was the correct way to fix it.

@kalgon exactly what I had in mind
@struberg want to give a look too? otherwise @tandraschko it looks good to me

it's fine for me
lets wait about marks feedback

looks like the issue is solved.
You can close it?

@struberg do you have write access to merge the PR then? 
I still can't. Didn't we migrate to gitbox already?
@tandraschko add github as a remote and fetch+merge the branch, it is simpler

simpler as a simple "merge" button here? :D not really.
Not sure but it works fine in MyFaces.

Hello, is there anything else needed I can help with to merge this PR?
If I am not mistaken, I don't think this change has made it to the SVN repository.
I will take care of it today

Applied it, thank you very much!
Please verify it in our svn and close the PR.
Looks good to me. Thanks!
@struberg FYI I may have some minor tweaks as I play with the different integration modes, so not quite ready to merge just yet
@struberg I've added documentation on how to use it. I believe this works for all six deployment options: fat/skinny axis and standalone/embedded/maven axis
@struberg FYI
@struberg this needs merging before a release
@struberg FYI

I'm fine both ways. Afaiu it doesn't change anything on the OWB side right?
It's just that 9.4.13..9.4.17 have been broken. 
And I hope jetty is a purely optional dependency anyway.
Means we do not pull in a specific version of jetty, do we?
closes #16
@struberg FYI
@struberg PING
I suspect you may want to tidy-up or re-org these tests though
CC @rmannibucau
@rmannibucau any chance you can merge this?
superceded by https://github.com/apache/openwebbeans/commit/d060bc811f6a58a43a694ca6fc7fe7ddf57442ed
After much consideration, better to let users decide. The compatible versions are documented and if somebody has a good reason to want to use 9.4.12 we should let them, no?
done, sorry for the delay

@stephenc is it normal I get that:

    [INFO]           fatwar/pom.xml ................................... SUCCESS (66.6 s)
    [INFO] Building: servletinjection/pom.xml
    [INFO]           servletinjection/pom.xml ......................... SUCCESS (10.4 s)

?
@rmannibucau well depends on what you mean by normal? the tests should pass on master (I verified that the two fatwar modules fail before your fix
@stephenc committed the tests but not sure why jetty/it/module fails regularly, looks underterministic (guess it setup)
Unsure why it would fail intermittently either. it passes every time for me
I managed to reproduce a failure in the jetty/module IT but only once out of 100 executions and it is unclear if that was just slow-down of start-up

On a hunch, I tried running the test inside docker... and that seems to reproduce the failure more often. What OS are you running the tests in?

The jetty maven plugin is warning, in such failures, that it couldn't verify successful start-up of the out-of-process jetty:

```
[INFO] Couldn't verify success of child startup
```
Aha! https://github.com/apache/openwebbeans/pull/21
@rmannibucau this should make that IT stable for you
Thanks a lot @stephenc , looks like it was it!
Thanks for the review @rmannibucau - Let me dig out some more context from the test. If it's a hook in TomEE that would benefit from changing that may be the better change.
I'm going to slowly "start over" on this, since I didn't see any email notification and didn't actually go back to check the PR manually until today. My bad.
Thanks @a-rekkusu !
thanks for the cosmetic change but it's not related to OWB-1317, so i will remove the ref
@philippkunz do we merge it like that or do you have pending work?

> do we merge it like that or do you have pending work?

No pending work is planned on my side. On the other hand I haven't got the feeling having answered all your questions and concerns sufficiently. If we assume having found that there is an acceptable solution at all now, it might be worth and I'd prefer to check all the small points again and improve them now rather than later as you see fit.

Thank you for all your valuable inputs.

I'm still interested to get a @CdiInjection extension but it can be done outside this PR so no issue to merge it like that.
I'm working on another unrelated extension but it can need some updates in @Cdi (adding properties typically) so I would like we avoid to create conflicts ;).
Now I was maybe too fast. Defining Cdi.DontInject as a Qualifier seems to slightly improve it. Hope you agree.

> Hope code is clearer than words ;)

If it helps to keep some overview here and if we are close to a merge, I'm happy to continue this discussion in another place (PR).
@philippkunz i press the button as soon as you say me it is good for you :)
I have no more changes planned in this PR. As an author I can't really say it's good. Taking it literally, it may do me good if you press the button though ;-).

@philippkunz extracted your change in a cdiinjection extension and extracted the DoneInject in its own class (SkipInject) since it is now shared between both extensions (guess it is better to not have 2 API even if it is trivial to have 2 qualifiers ;)). If you want to have a quick review it could be awesome to ensure I didn't break something you intended to do.
Think the if should still be done outside the while since, strating from 2 classes/pck, it simplifies the exec (faster).

Hi @a-rekkusu ,

Can you add a test to this PR to ensure it is readable by plain reflection (>> so it is properly handled by our vetoing logic)?

Hi @rmannibucau , 

will do it tomorrow, thanks!
@rmannibucau the test is there now, please take a look
@rmannibucau Thanks for merging this so quickly! Do you have any idea when this will be part of an openwebbeans release and eventually hit TomEE 8.0.*?

@RealCLanger guess OWB can be released anytime soon - just don't forget it is holidays time but no big blocker. On TomEE side I'm not 100% sure but it will be trivial to upgrade OWB in TomEE with current OWB state (just a dependency upgrade or distro patching with tomee-maven-plugin).
Fixed in Jetty
txs for the patch!
@struberg thank you for merging. i think, this is also useful for the master branch https://github.com/apache/openwebbeans/pull/38
2 years without response, lets close this for now
Looks like commons-io:commons-io is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

Hi @tt0suzy , AFAIK the order is deterministic _per run_ so code is fine and we don't need the overhead of the sort at runtime.

Thanks @jgallimore 
LGTM. I'll create a JIRA issue for it and merge.
